statement: Find the shortest distance between the paths of two rockets in free flight.  Take the first rocket path to be $\mathbf{r}=\mathbf{r}_1+t_1\mathbf{v}_1$ with launch at $\mathbf{r}_1=(1,1,1)$ and velocity $\mathbf{v}_1=(1,2,3)$ and the second rocket path as $\mathbf{r}=\mathbf{r}_2+t_2\mathbf{v}_2$ with $\mathbf{r}_2=(5,2,1)$ and $\mathbf{v}_2=(-1,-1,1)$.  Lengths are in kilometres, velocities in kilometres per hour.
